intro: Salpichroa ciliata, commonly known as the silky sida, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Americas. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features alternate, ovate to lanceolate leaves with ciliate margins. The flowers are small, white or pale pink, and are arranged in clusters at the ends of the branches. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. This plant is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
